content.description: Sit start with a far left-hand crimp bar and a right-hand match or out right on flake. Use some serious core and imagination to pop to a good sloping dish. Make a few more tight hand movements on the flake to gain the easy slab. Mind the rock behind you.
content.location: On the backside of the boulder with The Sickle, the bulge is very low to the ground, and the dish is obvious.

content.description: This uses the same start as The Red Arete. Once you gain the horizontal crack/jug, traverse left and gain a spot to pop up to the left arete to an easy finish.
content.location: Begin as for The Red Arete.

content.description: Sit start the left-trending finger crack. Gain the jug on the Red Arete (The Red Arete), and top out however you please.

Start sitting. Reach up for the underclings, pull off the ground (crux), and dyno for the lip. 

  This is very height-dependent. Taller folks have suggested V7. For me, it felt like solid V8....

Start with both hands on a solid jug and good feet on a large, right- leaning rail. Bump up to a good right crimp and throw for a left compression. Move your feet up, move for the last large jug on top, and top out.
content.location: This is at the south end of the valley just across from Billy Breathes.

content.description: This is a good, easy problem. Start with thin feet and a good crimp and follow up the three rails to the top.
content.location: This is on the other side of the block from Swoop The Scoop.

content.description: Down the hill from The Alcove, this problem climbs the rainbow-like looking feature above a little cave. Start to the left of the cave on edges and traverse rightwards on slopers and crimps topping out on the right arete.
content.location: This problem is down below the alcove situated lower on the hill. When approaching the Alcove, it is the rainbow looking cave feature that is hard to miss.

content.description: Awesome. Start low on two good jug pockets. Heel hook and slap the arete to a good hold and a dicey topout.
content.location: This is in the Valley, you can't miss it.

content.description: Start on good holds under the small roof. Traverse the crack/pockets/crimps along the face to an obvious good hold and top out.
content.location: This is in the center of the Valley, you can't miss it.

content.description: Sit start the steep arête with left on smears and right on a decent crimp. Pop to a pinch, match left next to the pinch, and move right to top out.
content.location: This is about 15 feet left of the problem Billy Breathes.

content.description: Stand start matched on the crimp bar, move up, and top out.
content.location: This is on the backside of the boulder with the problem Dab Police on it.

content.description: Start matched on a flake/jug with a good low left foot. Bump along the sloping lip to an easy rock-over/mantle top out.
content.location: This is on a small boulder directly to the right of Chicken Wing.

content.description:
This is the slopey arete that Dab Police finishes on. Sit start low on the far right end,  move left to the Dab Police lip, and press out.   

  Pulling up and getting going is the crux.
This is a one move wonder at its best. Start matched on a giant undercling, paste your feet, and throw to the lip.  For taller people it may feel much easier, for shorter people much harder.
content.location: If you are looking at the V1 face pocket problem, turn 180 degrees and you will see it.

content.description: Start on two good holds in the horizontal crack/ledge. A right hand gaston on the big feature (chicken wing) and reach for the lip just below the upper arete. Climb the upper arete and top out. The boulder below is off, of course.
content.location: This is on the same boulder as Pocket Face, around to the right.

content.description: Sit start on the right side of the boulder with a right on the lip of arête and left on a crimp, and traverse left to top out as for the problem Billy Breathes.
content.location: This is on the far right side of the boulder about 8 feet right of the start of the problem Billy Breathes.

content.description: Start on a jug on the left side with shitty feet. Pop right to good crimp, and bring your feet up. Make a big move to small but okay crimp, then top out.
content.location: Continue to walk past the The Ground Round for approximately 30 feet and then turn around.

pathTokens: Cavalry Boulder Field aka Gymnasium aka Playground

content.description: This is the most dense concentration of boulders in this area, there are many problems in a small area. Walk the trail and when you get to a bunch of boulders you know you are there.
